name: Atharva Patil
details:
second year eecs major. A few artists i listen to: Tyler the Creator, Brockhampton, A Boogie wit da Hoodie, Mac Miller, YBN, and more. Courses taken: CS61AB, EE16AB. I was involved in a consulting club last semester. I browse reddit, twitter and youtube if that gives any idea of my personality. 

The reason I became a mentor is so I can explain concepts I originally struggled on to current students, in an effort to reduce the general confusion and lack of resources regarding EE concepts. In my opinion, the ee16 series is poorly taught starting from the lectures, where concepts are introduced in such a theoretical manner. Combined with the tedious and difficult homeworks, EE can quickly become a complex subject. Yet, with exams being mostly technical questions, ee16a just becomes a matter of solidifying concepts and applying them on the tests. I hope that with some guidance, students will not have much difficulty in the class.

name: Cheng (Bob) Cao
details:
Hello! I'm Cheng Cao (or you can call me Bob). I'm a sophomore, Computer Science major, and I'm from Shanghai, China.

I started learning programming since very young, largely due to the fact that I love playing computer games and wanting to know how to make them. I'm still on that path and my favorite topics in computer science is graphics and rendering. I spent most of my Sunday gaming and my absolute favorite games are StarCraft 2 and Overwatch -- but I'm not good in both of these (If you are a master in either of this please teach me how to play).

I'm not very good at taking tests or quizzes, but I know a wide range of things and topics in CS. I'd like to focus more on the concepts behind how each theory or mechanism works, and if you want to lean the concepts or clarify the questions you had, I absolutely welcome you to my session!

name: Evan Sum

Aside from tutoring, I love going to gym, watching football and basketball, and driving back to Sac almost every weekend to spend time with family / my cat. Feel free to talk to me if you have any questions about 61C, transferring, lifting, or really anything at all!

name: Matthew Lee

I'm from Boston (yeah pahk the cah in Hahvahd yahd or whatever) and this will be my second year studying CS at Cal! I do a lot of work in Natural Language Processing, so hit me up if you're interested in teaching computers to read or making cool word visualizations. Outside of dancing, teaching, and programming, I am an avid runner, music nerd, and subpar babysitter. Can't wait for an awesome semester!
